instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Slow to start
threads.message:
Logic and DCIN flex are out of the Mac on bench. THis board starts and boots upon initial attachment of proper magsafe charger. However if you unplug the charger and plug it back in, it can take up to 45 seconds for it to come back on. Measuring <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> when this occurs it hangs around .3-.4V for a while before going to 16V. 

Swapped known good DCIN board/flex. Also have changed SMC, <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> and ultimately J4700 in efforts to get the charger light to come on (J4700 was the problem with charger light) This problem existed prior to changing those and after. Also tried changing <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> and components around it, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>...

It seems like something isn't resetting to allow the board to restart?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Slow to start
threads.message:
Looks like input leakage issue.
Did you test with fake charger, or lab PSU?

I will start changing <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>/85.
